buyback.translation[0].definitions[0].de: when someone buys something that they previously had sold
buyback.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Good economic data strengthened sterling and prompted buybacks of the currency.
Porsche’s buyback scheme will guarantee a value of 55% of the car’s purchase price at the end of three years.
buyback.translation[0].definitions[1].de: when a company buys its own shares from existing shareholders
buyback.translation[0].definitions[2].de: when the owners of a company previously sold to another become independent again by buying their shares from the new owners
buyback.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: William A Robinson, a Chicago marketing agency acquired three years ago by Ketchum Communications, completed its buyback from Ketchum and renamed itself Robinson & Maites.
